oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wool Broadside
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Wool; Wool industry
Agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside advertisng a woolen mill in Fayetteville, Tennessee under the ownership of James M. Griffin. The advertisement encourages people to bring their wool to Griffin "for which he will pay the highest market price in cash" or goods.

Although better cotton lands in the South led Tennessee farmers to concentrate on other crops, the Civil War virtually destoryed the wool industry in the South. This broadside represents a return to cotton production by Tennesseans during the last stages of Reconstruction.
